Reviews.Title: “Great Benefit for Money Value”
Reviews.Author: mtorres108
Reviews.Content: Stayed in City Express EBC this last weekend with girls friends. In my opinion, the BESTs of this hotel are location and service. It is located across the street a fine Plaza for shopping, eating, Starbucks, pharmacy, etc, AND only 1 block from a nice area of Paseo Reforma. Very safe and convinient location. During our stay, we needed extra towels and hairdryers, which were provided righ way from the hotel staff. We also ordered wine for room service and were perfectly serviced. We didn't want to wait the check-in time, so we left our lugage with the front office with no extra charge. Other words: service was excellent Continental breakfast was ok. I always expect a lot from breakfasts, this one was simply ok, nothing special. But they offer a menu with eggs and other typical foods if anyone wants. The room was small, with 2 matrimonial beds. Matrimonial doesn't mean queen or king sized, it's a smaller sized bed, not very comfortable for 2 people to sleep. We atayed at the 12th floor, and it was quiet and dark at night, and it had new appliances. Bathroom with few amenities available, but everything running perfectly. I'll definetly stay there again if I'm running a lower cost trip. If you want a more fine-tunned place, there's a Holiday Inn in that very same Shopping Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: EliteLevel
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a very short term Hotel at a great location where almost everything you may need is located at a walking distance then you might pick this hotel. The front desk staff was friendly. The rooms are very smalls 96 sq ft. The air conditioner unit works great. The breakfast options could be much better. My room was clean but I observed how a food tray last 1 and half day in the middle of the corridor. The Internet Wireless speed was good.

Reviews.Title: “City Express was great”
Reviews.Author: El-Yuca-Ingles
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the City Express EBC Reforma the 1st week of Feb. I found the hotel to be just fine, the room was pleasant, quiet, and with comfortable bed, good bathroom, and nice shower. Everything was spotlessly clean. The wireless internet worked fine, and the included breakfast was good - better than the Holiday Inn Express Reforma where I stayed a couple of weeks previously. The restaurant was open all day, but I did not eat any other meals there, since the area is full of good eating and drinking options. At more or less half the price of the HI Express, I consider this to be a much better deal, right around the corner. I used the City Express for a business event, and rented a meeting room for 2 days; the reservation was efficiently handled, and the room was ready and laid out as per my request. Overall, I was very happy with this hotel and would stay again without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: YoungDiver
Reviews.Content: If you go have to work around the area, this a great place to stay. The location is excellent, right in front of a mall, very calm at night, lot of restaurants nearby, even exciting night life if that's what you want. I felt very safe walking around the area. The rooms are small, but I think it's good for what you pay. Bad things: - The shower was a little dirty (the walls had a bit of mold) - The bed and pillows were just not comfortable

Reviews.Title: “good value for the $$, however....”
Reviews.Author: aes523
Reviews.Content: .....we've never slept on a more uncomfortable bed. Also, the windows opened but had no screens, so we were bitten by some mosquitos in the night.. The room was very tiny but had everything we needed. The service was very nice despite limited English. A great location, 1/2 block off Paseo de la Reforma and across the street from a very large and nice mall. About a 5-minute walk to the US Embassy.

Reviews.Title: “New and nice hotel, but very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: paris-eric
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I were staying in this hotel during the huge Aids Conference in Mexico. Rooms are OK but very few staff members can speak English. I have requested many times my aircon to be fixed, but it remained out of order during the 13 nights I spent there. Expect to wait one or two days to get something simple, like a laundry bag. Each guest can experience the lack of competence, the confusion when an issue is raised. At the end, I was feeling sorry for them, because I believed they did not receive the adequate training.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean. a very good deal”
Reviews.Author: newmix
Reviews.Content: this hotel is really good very clean, around $60 dollars. the staff was really nice with me all the time. i dont know anything about the food. my bathroom was clean. the rooms are small, BUT, tv cable, internet connection, A/C, king size bed. and the staff is always very friendly
